title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

spliffy joined #xwiki at 05:58

Denis joined #xwiki at 06:09

mflorea joined #xwiki at 08:26  
xwikibot joined #xwiki at 10:49  
jvelociter - (10:58): tmortagne: hum that's strange I cannot reproduce  
jvelociter - (10:58): let me try with a hudson build  
tmortagne - (11:06): jvelociter:  the error itself is pretty weird  
tmortagne - (11:06): look slike a getObject is returning null even if there is a query to select document based on a class before it  
jvelociter - (11:07): yes that was what I was lookign at  
jvelociter - (11:07): wonder how it's possible !  
tmortagne - (11:07): yep  
tmortagne - (11:07): will try to debug  
jvelociter - (11:07): you have nothing custom ?  
tmortagne - (11:07): custom like what ?  
jvelociter - (11:08): I don't know. It's your XEM debug env ?  
tmortagne - (11:08): yes  
jvelociter - (11:08): I don't reproduce on XE built by hudson  
tmortagne - (11:08): i'm debuging, will see  
mflorea left at 11:10 (Quit: Leaving.  
tmortagne - (11:13): jvelociter: first step: i fond the document which has the issue: XWiki.SchedulerJobTemplate  
jvelociter - (11:13): yes that's what I had in mind initially  
tmortagne - (11:13): for some reason it's fond by the query but getObject can't find object  
jvelociter - (11:13): but strange it can't get the object  
tmortagne - (11:13): which does not really make sense  
tmortagne - (11:14): probably a multiwiki issue with the class full name  
tmortagne - (11:14): checking  
tmortagne - (11:14): btw i have several wikis  
tmortagne - (11:16): actually looks like it's happening on main wiki  
Enygma` joined #xwiki at 11:16  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 11:18  
tmortagne - (11:18): ha no this one is ok, the issue is when on another wiki  
tmortagne - (11:19): jvelociter: i need to  check but i think i know what's wrong, i have pretty nasty wikis on my instance ;)  
tmortagne - (11:20): i thin kthis one does not have the class  
tmortagne - (11:20): for some reason  
jvelociter - (11:20): ah ok  
tmortagne - (11:20): but have the template  
tmortagne - (11:20): which mean it's found by query but when loading the document the xobject is not loaded because there is no class  
jvelociter - (11:20): that what I was reffering to by nothing custom ? :)  
jvelociter - (11:20): ok, make sense  
tmortagne - (11:21): but i don't understand what the template is doing here  
tmortagne - (11:21): this wiki is supposed to be completely empty  
tmortagne - (11:21): and i certainly not imported it alone myself  
tmortagne - (11:21): is the plugin automatically creating it or something ?  
tmortagne - (11:22): jvelociter: still, something that is not great is that an error like that crash init  
tmortagne - (11:23): init()  
jvelociter - (11:23): yep. No I don't think the plugin creates the template lazily  
tmortagne - (11:23): wich mean any wiki in this state and you loose all folowing wiki jobs  
jvelociter - (11:25): yep that's pretty bad  
lucaa left at 11:25 (Ping timeout: 264 seconds  
tmortagne - (11:25): restoreExistingJobs should probably catch Exception instead of XWikiException  
tmortagne - (11:30): jvelociter: unfortunately i was wrong, this wiki is not empty and contain a class  
tmortagne - (11:30): so it's more complex than that  
jvelociter - (11:30): arf  
tmortagne - (11:30): so we have an issue with template job on subwikis it seems  
tmortagne - (11:31): (and template job was not loaded previously)  
tmortagne - (11:32): i don't understand anything now: when i look at XWiki.SchedulerJobTemplate i can't find any object using object aditor  
tmortagne - (11:32): editor  
tmortagne - (11:34): i found a document in a pretty weird state it seems  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 11:44  
tmortagne - (11:49): jvelociter: so here is the final reason: when looking at there is a class, there is a scheduler job template document and an object in scheduler job template of the proper class  
tmortagne - (11:49): but i discovered something in the database  
tmortagne - (11:49): we have a field "elements" in document table which indicate how many element this document contains  
tmortagne - (11:50): and well for some reason this fiels is set to 0 for  XWiki.SchedulerJobTemplate  
tmortagne - (11:50): never seen something like that before  
tmortagne - (11:51): so there is no bug  
tmortagne - (11:52): (but i will protect a bit more restoreExistingJobs, never too carefull)  
tmortagne - (11:53): jvelociter: ok i i reuse XASCH-61 ?  
vmassol - (11:53): ok let's fix this "swizzle plugin not installed"  
spliffy left at 11:53 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
spliffy joined #xwiki at 11:54  
jstoldt\_ joined #xwiki at 11:56  
jstoldt\_ - (11:56): hi  
jstoldt\_ - (11:56): i am currently trying to make XWiki 2.6 run on jetty 7  
jstoldt\_ - (11:56): but i keep getting No such OPTIONS: jdbc  
jstoldt\_ - (11:57): could anyone give me just a little hint how to fix this?  
jvelociter - (11:57): tmortagne: yes that's fine by me  
cjdelisle` - (11:58): jstoldt\_, Is that all it's outputing? "No such OPTIONS: jdbc"?  
jstoldt\_ - (11:59): it then goes on with 5 or 6 lines of at org.eclipse.[somemore]  
jstoldt\_ - (11:59): but all java related, apparently  
cjdelisle` - (11:59): Can you pastebin it?  
sburjan - (12:00): maybe t he jdbc url is malformed  
jstoldt\_ - (12:01): i'd can't simply copy&paste it because it's in the win command prompt  
tmortagne - (12:01): jvelociter: also there is something weird in restoreExistingJobs, we have a try/catch around each job initialization but if one of the job fail we throw an exception on purpose it seems which means we loose following jobs that probably don't have any issue  
jstoldt\_ - (12:01): which would be a bit of a pain  
tmortagne - (12:01): jvelociter: ok to put a log instead ?  
jvelociter - (12:02): tmortagne: +1  
cjdelisle` - (12:02): There is no way to copy from the command prompt in windows? I can in linux.  
jstoldt\_ - (12:02): ahhh  
jstoldt\_ - (12:02): there is  
tmortagne - (12:02): cjdelisle`: yes you can  
jstoldt\_ - (12:02): i learned something today! :-D  
tmortagne - (12:02): but i don't remember the command  
sburjan - (12:03): cjdelisle`: jstoldt : there is. You right click on the window, check "Mark" .. select text .. and press enter  
tmortagne - (12:03): did you tried "copy" command ?  
sburjan - (12:03): so the content wil lbe copies  
jstoldt\_ - (12:03): http://pastebin.ca/2002783  
tmortagne - (12:03): ha you mean copy some test from the command prompt ?  
tmortagne - (12:03): s/test/text/  
jstoldt\_ - (12:03): sburjan: yeah, just figured that out... did not know before :-D  
arkub joined #xwiki at 12:04  
tmortagne - (12:04): jstoldt\_: all you see in the command is probably logged in a file too  
sabageru left at 12:05 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
jstoldt\_ - (12:05): tmortagne: could not find a file containing that information but i figured out how to copy&paste from command prompt after some 10 years working with windows X-D  
tmortagne - (12:05): :)  
sburjan - (12:06): :)  
tmortagne - (12:06): there is also some alternative command prompt for windows but very long time since I used one so i would not know what is famous now  
jstoldt\_ - (12:07): right  
jstoldt\_ - (12:07): anyway, anyone got a hint for me on the jdbc thingy in jetty 7?  
jvelociter - (12:10): restarting xwiki.org  
tmortagne - (12:10): sorry never seen something like that, that's all you have ?  
jstoldt\_ - (12:10): well, yes...  
xwikibot joined #xwiki at 12:12  
vmassol - (12:13): XWIKI-1000  
vmassol - (12:13): grrr  
jstoldt\_ - (12:13): lol, the heck?! it fails on a clean package  
jstoldt\_ - (12:13): this is messed up -.-  
vmassol - (12:13): jvelociter: didn't work. We have the 2 jars now?  
jvelociter - (12:13): vxwikiorgfarm:/usr/local# ls xwiki/WEB-INF/lib/|grep swizzle  
jstoldt\_ - (12:13): are you guys using jetty 7 or only 6?  
jvelociter - (12:13): swizzle-confluence-1.2-20080419-xwiki.jar  
jvelociter - (12:13): swizzle-jira-1.3.3-20070817-xwiki.jar  
jvelociter - (12:13): vxwikiorgfarm:/usr/local#  
jvelociter - (12:14): java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.xpn.xwiki.plugin.swizzle.SwizzleJiraPlugin  
jvelociter - (12:14): ok  
jvelociter - (12:14): missing the plugin it seems now  
vmassol - (12:14): jvelociter: I don't see xwiki-plugin-swizzle  
vmassol - (12:14): yes  
cjdelisle` - (12:15): jstoldt, 6.1  
xwikibot joined #xwiki at 12:17  
jvelociter - (12:17): ok remains a java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.xpn.xwiki.plugin.collection.CollectionPlugin for the collection plugin  
jvelociter - (12:17): but that's nornal  
vmassol - (12:18): who started the bot?  
jvelociter - (12:18): I should have removed it from conf  
jvelociter - (12:18): cron ?  
vmassol - (12:18): XWIKI-1000  
vmassol - (12:18): back… ahhhhh :)  
vmassol - (12:18): (there's no cron)  
jvelociter - (12:19): then I don't know  
jvelociter - (12:19): not me :)  
jvelociter - (12:19): and there is just you and me on the machine  
jvelociter - (12:19): that leaves....  
jvelociter - (12:20): or is there a web interface to start the bot ?  
vmassol - (12:20): jvelociter: yes  
vmassol - (12:20): but protected  
jstoldt\_ - (12:21): okay, i think the major problem was that jetty 7.2.0 and 7.2.1 are fucked -.-  
jvelociter\_ joined #xwiki at 12:31  
cjdelisle` - (12:31): Does xwiki.org seem to have any more horsepower since the upgrade?  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 12:33  
jvelociter left at 12:35 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds  
jvelociter\_ is now known as jvelociter ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)

sabageru joined #xwiki at 12:52  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 12:53  
lucaa left at 13:12 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
vmassol - (13:25): sdumitriu: are you ok for me to add to the ssx on xwiki.org:  
vmassol - (13:25): textarea { width: 100% }  
vmassol - (13:25): ?  
vmassol - (13:25): I'd like that all textarea on code.xwiki.org when editing/adding snippets, macros, etc take the full width  
vmassol - (13:29): hmm ssx are not shared between wikis so I'll add a SSX on code.xwiki.org for now  
vmassol - (13:30): shouldn't we have this by default for all textareas generated by XClasses?  
sdumitriu - (13:30): vmassol: OK  
vmassol - (13:33): tmortagne: would be great if you could add a few lines to http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Snippets/ExcelImportScaffoldingSnippet to explain what it does  
tmortagne - (13:35): vmassol: I have no idea what is this  
vmassol - (13:35): ah it's jerome  
tmortagne - (13:35): did you mean jvelociter ?  
vmassol - (13:35): jvelociter: would be great if you could add a few lines to http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Snippets/ExcelImportScaffoldingSnippet to explain what it does  
jvelociter - (13:36): vmassol: yep ok  
vmassol - (13:36): cjdelisle`: you had forgotten to add a SheetClass to XWiki.SnippetClassSheet20  
vmassol - (13:36): (I have added it)  
arkub left at 13:37 (Ping timeout: 250 seconds  
cjdelisle` - (13:37): Ok. What happened as a result?  
cjdelisle` - (13:37): I guess I don't know what it's for then.  
vmassol - (13:37): cjdelisle`: it allows to automatically swtich to edit mode when clicking edit  
vmassol - (13:41): hmm the display of any snippets has a vertical scrollbar in chrome. For ex: http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Snippets/RunShellCommandSnippet  
tmortagne - (13:41): vmassol: i forgot it too in PluginClassSheet  
vmassol - (13:42): tmortagne: ok  
tmortagne - (13:42): i lokked at other sheets, looks ok now  
vmassol - (13:42): ok  
vmassol - (13:42): I'm fixing titles  
vmassol - (13:43): the strategy I'm using (done for snippets FTM) is to set the title when creating the page  
vmassol - (13:43): (thus not adding a top level header in the class sheet)  
vmassol - (13:44): that's a fyi  
vmassol - (13:49): tmortagne: we have something strange  
vmassol - (13:49): on one page in XWiki syntax 2.1, add: image:icon:accept  
vmassol - (13:49): then in another page in syntax 2.0, add {{include document="first page"/}}  
vmassol - (13:50): it works  
vmassol - (13:50): (which is the strange part)  
vmassol - (13:50): any idea?  
vmassol - (13:50): now wrap the image:icon:accept in a {{velocity}} block and it doesn't work  
tmortagne - (13:52): the fact that its working is not stange  
tmortagne - (13:52): why would it ?  
tmortagne - (13:53): and it's not working inside velocity because you loose the fact that velocity macro contains 2.1 syntax when you import  
vmassol - (13:54): well include has context = current by default  
vmassol - (13:54): so it's executed in the the context of a 2.0 page  
tmortagne - (13:54): we need http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-4802 to support that  
vmassol - (13:54): so it shouldn't work  
tmortagne - (13:54): that's excatly what i just explained to you  
tmortagne - (13:54): you loose information about velocity content  
vmassol - (13:55): I mea without the velocity  
tmortagne - (13:55): because whgen you execute it you don't know it's 2.1  
tmortagne - (13:55): without the velocity the parser know it's parsing 2.1 syntax  
tmortagne - (13:55): and produce XDOM  
vmassol - (13:55): I need to read the incude macro code again I guess  
tmortagne - (13:55): include is working at XDOM level  
vmassol - (13:55): mentally I thought it was a copy content and then execute  
tmortagne - (13:55): it does not merge text  
vmassol - (13:56): ok  
tmortagne - (13:56): all macros are working at XDOM level  
tmortagne - (13:56): if include macro was working at text level it would be very bad, that's the point of having XDOM, not manipulate text  
tmortagne - (13:57): the only thing missing if to have contextual information at block level to not loose the fact that the velocity macro is supposed to contains syntax 2.1  
vmassol - (13:57): ok  
vmassol - (13:57): I've checked the soruces and I understand npw  
vmassol - (13:57): now  
vmassol - (13:58): (we're extracting the syntax from the included doc)  
tmortagne - (13:58): and anyway you can't merge texts because when you execute include you don't know the text of the top documebnt  
vmassol - (13:58): thanks for the explanation  
vmassol - (13:58): jvelociter: so the reason is http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-4802 . If this was implemented you'd not have to have your including doc in 2.1 syntax ;)  
jvelociter - (14:00): ok  
vmassol - (14:08): jvelociter: do you know why typing "velo" in the livetable title field doesn't find the VelocityMacro item?  
vmassol - (14:08): (on http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Macros/ )  
tmortagne - (14:08): di you tried Velo ?  
vmassol - (14:08): yes  
jvelociter - (14:08): no that's strange  
tmortagne - (14:08): and it's not working either ?  
jvelociter - (14:09): I did not reserve the word velo  
jvelociter - (14:09): LD  
vmassol - (14:09): :)  
jvelociter - (14:09): I know  
vmassol - (14:09): I guess it would work if I were dispalying doc names instead of titles  
jvelociter - (14:09): it's because it does not have a title  
jvelociter - (14:09): and you are searching on the title field  
vmassol - (14:09): but it displays VelcityMacro in that field though  
jvelociter - (14:10): yes that might be a fallback  
vmassol - (14:10): so dislay and search are not the same  
jvelociter - (14:10): we should remove it IMO  
jvelociter - (14:10): OR  
jvelociter - (14:10): we should make the title mandatory by default  
spliffy left at 14:11 (Remote host closed the connection  
jvelociter - (14:12): ah vmassol  maybe I know  
jvelociter - (14:12): we might use getDisplayTitle for the title  
jvelociter - (14:12): instead of real doc.title  
vmassol - (14:13): yes  
vmassol - (14:20): jvelociter: can we make that getdisplaytitle change on xwiki.prg? Where is it located?  
jvelociter - (14:22): vmassol: yes, will do it  
sdumitriu left at 14:23 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
vmassol - (14:23): cool  
jstoldt\_ - (14:25): christ, i hate java... never had problems this bad getting to run any prog as a win service -.-  
jstoldt\_ - (14:26): jetty 7 does not come with that functionality and i can't find a freaking solution that lets me do it without failing miserably  
sburjan - (14:26): are you sure it supports running as a service ?  
jstoldt\_ - (14:27): it used to in version 6  
jstoldt\_ - (14:27): but dropped support in version 7  
jstoldt\_ - (14:27): some people say they found a solution  
tmortagne - (14:27): not a good sign  
jstoldt\_ - (14:27): but i can't get any of that to work  
jstoldt\_ - (14:27): i tried about 10 solutions by now  
jstoldt\_ - (14:27): lot of wrappers that are supposed to make this work  
jstoldt\_ - (14:27): this is really frustrating  
jstoldt\_ - (14:28): for .exe files it's no more than a few chars i type into the command prompt  
jstoldt\_ - (14:28): but java is making it shit load more difficult.  
sburjan - (14:28): this is very odd they dropped support as service from version 7  
jstoldt\_ - (14:28): very much so  
cjdelisle` - (14:29): Can you run from the command line just to see if attachments treat you any better?  
jstoldt\_ - (14:29): well, i could run from attachment, i got it configured that far  
jstoldt\_ - (14:29): problem is, i need this to run as service  
jstoldt\_ - (14:30): so even if it was better i'd be stuck using tomcat because it has service capability  
cjdelisle` - (14:30): Well if it works then you can look at making it run as a service.  
jstoldt\_ - (14:30): besides, i was trying a wee bit with tomcat earlier and no attachment trouble there, only some weird stuff going on with the office viewer macro, but that is another thing to check out before reporting  
jstoldt\_ - (14:31): cjdelisle`: i'm trying for about 3 hours to run jetty as a service now and nothing will work for me  
sburjan - (14:31): jstoldt: what attachment issue do you have ?  
jstoldt\_ - (14:31): for latest 6.x version of jetty the functionality was broken and i couldn't make it run as a service  
arkub joined #xwiki at 14:31  
jstoldt\_ - (14:32): sburjan: random stuff... sometimes old revisions are not stored, sometimes new revisions are not accepted... stuff like that  
jstoldt\_ - (14:32): sometimes i can't even delete stuff until i restart tomcat  
jstoldt\_ - (14:32): but like i say, it's fairly random  
cjdelisle` - (14:32): I wouldn't bother getting anything to run as a service until I knew everything else was working but that's just me.  
sburjan - (14:32): very odd  
jstoldt\_ - (14:32): and i can't really make sense of that  
jstoldt\_ - (14:33): cjdelisle`: well, for me it's more important to be running something fairly good as a service than running something just fine without having this as a service  
jstoldt\_ - (14:33): problem is, i need to have this stuff running somehow without having to be anywhere near the server at any point in the future  
sburjan - (14:33): why are you so service dependent ?  
sburjan - (14:33): oh I see  
jstoldt\_ - (14:33): because i am only here for half a year, basically...  
sburjan - (14:34): well... find another container .. IMO jetty is a small container  
jstoldt\_ - (14:34): if things turn out bad - and things are not looking to good with the IT being outsourced to IBM - i'll have to keep this thing running on the current temporary server/workstation  
sburjan - (14:34): i guess something like JBoss would do the service job  
jstoldt\_ - (14:34): yeah, i was experimenting with IIS and RESIN this morning but i couldn't get it to run either  
jstoldt\_ - (14:35): well, if JBoss is fine i could give it a shot  
jstoldt\_ - (14:35): i was opting for jetty now as a replacement for tomcat because cjdelisle` suggested it  
jstoldt\_ - (14:35): and it's used in the standalone  
cjdelisle` - (14:36): Let me know when you have something working and are able to continue debugging the attachment issue.  
jstoldt\_ - (14:36): sure
